Name: DOWNWIND DIRECTION IN MILS
Explanation: THE VALUE OF 9999 CAN BE USED TO INDICATE A VARIABLE WIND DIRECTION.

Name: AZIMUTH OF FIRE IN MILS FROM GRID NORTH
ATTITUDE IN MILS FROM GRID NORTH
ANGLE TO CREST IN MILS POSITIVE OR NEGATIVE
Explanation: AN POSITIVE OR NEGATIVE ANGLE IN MILS MEASURED RELATIVE TO AN ANGLE PERPENDICULAR TO THE EARTH'S GRAVITATIONAL FORCES AT THE LOCATION OF THE OBSERVER.

Name: ANGLE T IN MILS
Explanation: THE ANGLE FORMED FROM A WEAPON SYSTEM, TO A TARGET, TO AN OBSERVER.

Name: DIRECTION OF SHELL GROOVE IN MILS
Explanation: THE DIRECTION IN MILS MEASURED CLOCKWISE FROM THE POINT OF SHELL IMPACT TO ITS PLACE OF ORIGIN.

Name: OBSERVER-FLASH SOUND AZIMUTH TO HOSTILE BATTERY IN MILS
Explanation: THE DIRECTION IN MILS MEASURED CLOCKWISE FROM AN OBSERVER TO THE FLASH OR SOUND ASSOCIATED WITH FIRE SUPPORT OPERATIONS.
